class.name: jsx3.gui.Matrix
class.text: The Matrix control is the standard visual interface for the Common Data Format (CDF), providing grid and tree-grid functionality that mirrors the the record and attribute structures used by the CDF. Instances of this class can be used to create editable grids, selectable lists, trees, tables, etc. In addtion to providing layout, selection, and editing schemes, the Matrix also provides various paging models to help optimize how (and how much) data is rendered on-screen. The Matrix class is always used in conjunction with jsx3.gui.Matrix.Column, which describes how data for a given series should be rendered on-screen. While the Matrix manages data and user interactions, Column manages the on-screen format for how the data is presented.

nested.name: jsx3.gui.Matrix.Column
nested.text: Column control for use as a child of a jsx3.gui.Matrix class

nested.name: jsx3.gui.Matrix.ColumnFormat
nested.text: A class that defines the methods required for an object to be used by jsx3.gui.Matrix.Column instances to format cells of data.

param.name: strName
param.text: unique name distinguishing this object from all other JSX GUI objects in the JSX application

field.name: APPEND_IMG
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/append.gif

field.name: DEFAULT_INFO_LABEL
field.text:
"Viewing rows {0} to {1} of {2}".
Wildcards are as follows:
{0} The index position of the first visible on-screen row
{1} The index position of the last visible on-screen row
{2} Total count of all records in the list

field.name: DEFAULT_PANEL_POOL_COUNT
field.text: 18. number of panels allowed on-screen before destroying the panel most distant from the current panel index

field.name: DEFAULT_PANEL_QUEUE_SIZE
field.text: 3. number of panels in the paint queue. As new panels are added to the queue to be painted, older, less-relevant panels in the queue are removed

field.name: DEFAULT_REAPER_INTERVAL
field.text: 250. number of milliseconds between the time a new panel is added and the reaper checks for content exceeding jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_PANEL_POOL_COUNT

field.name: DEFAULT_ROWS_PER_PANEL
field.text: 50. number of rows in a given panel

field.name: FOCUS_STYLE
field.text: font-weight:bold

field.name: ICON
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/file.gif (default)

field.name: ICON_MINUS
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/minus.gif (default)

field.name: ICON_PLUS
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/plus.gif (default)

field.name: INSERT_BEFORE_IMG
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/insert_before.gif

field.name: MINIMUM_COLUMN_WIDTH
field.text: 4. minimum width of a column when minimized (set Display to 'none' to completely hide a column)

field.name: ON_PAINT_PAGE
field.text: jsxpaintpage. Event to subscribe to each time a page of content is about to be painted on-screen

field.name: PAGING_2PASS
field.text: The outer container is first painted and then the entirety of the data is painted during a second pass

field.name: PAGING_CHUNKED
field.text: The outer container is first painted. Chunked sets of data are painted on-screen during repeated passes until all data is painted

field.name: PAGING_OFF
field.text: Default. All data is painted at once with the outer container.

field.name: PAGING_PAGED
field.text: The outer container is first painted. The first and last panels are painted during a second pass. As the user scrolls, relevant panels are added and unused panels are collected. (NOTE: Requires that row height be fixed.)

field.name: PAGING_STEPPED
field.text: The outer container is painted along with any rows which are immediate children of the rendering context and those descendant rows that have an open path to the context node. All other rows will be fetched when the state for their on-screen parent row is toggled to open.

field.name: SELECTION_BG
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/select.gif

field.name: SELECTION_ROW
field.text: 1 (default)

field.name: SORT_ASCENDING
field.text: ascending

field.name: SORT_ASCENDING_IMG
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/sort_asc.gif (default)

field.name: SORT_DESCENDING
field.text: descending

field.name: SORT_DESCENDING_IMG
field.text: jsx:///images/matrix/sort_desc.gif (default)

nested.name: jsx3.gui.Matrix.BlockMask
nested.text: The interface that defines the methods that affect the behavior of a composite object used as an edit mask of a matrix column.

nested.name: jsx3.gui.Matrix.EditMask
nested.text: The interface defining the methods that affect the behavior of an object used as an edit mask in a matrix column.

method.name: adoptChild

param.name: objChild
param.text: the child to adopt

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true or null, the object being adopted will be added to the parent's view via the parent's paintChild() method. This parameter is made available for those situations where a loop is executing and multiple objects are being adopted. As view operations are the most CPU intensive, passing false while looping through a collection of child objects to adopt will improve performance. After the last child is adopted, simply call repaint() on the parent to immediately synchronize the view.

param.name: bForce
param.text: if true, the adoption is forced, even if the parent/child don't accept such adoptions (onSetChild() and onSetParent() will still be called)

method.text: Instance override

method.name: commitAutoRowSession

param.name: objEvent
param.text: If passed, Allows Model Event to fire.

param.name: intCellIndex
param.text: Focus will be applied to the autorow cell at this index (zero-based)

method.text: Commits any active autorow session.

method.name: deleteRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to remove.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the deleted record.

return.text: the record removed from the data source or null if no such record found.

method.text: Removes a record from the XML data source of this object.

method.name: deselectAllRecords
method.text: Deselects all selected CDF records.

method.name: deselectRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the record to deselect.

method.text: Deselects a CDF record within the Matrix. Both the view and the data model (CDF) will be updated

method.name: doSort

param.name: intSortDir
param.text: jsx3.gui.Matrix.SORT_ASCENDING or jsx3.gui.Matrix.SORT_DESCENDING.

method.text: Sorts according to the current sort path. If no sort direction is specified, the value will be toggled.

method.name: doValidate
method.text: STATEINVALID is returned if the required property of this control is true and no selection is made.

method.name: executeRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the CDF record to execute.

method.text: Evaluates the JavaScript code in the jsxexecute attribute of one CDF record of this list.

method.name: focusCellById

param.name: strCdfId
param.text: jsxid property for CDF record

param.name: strAttName
param.text: attribute name on the CDF record. For example, jsxtext

method.text: Applies focus to the on-screen cell that corresponds to the intersection of the element in the CDF source document identified by strCdfId, and the first column mapped to strAttName.

method.name: focusCellByIndex

param.name: strCdfId
param.text: jsxid property for CDF record

param.name: intCellIndex
param.text: zero-based index of cell (on-screen).

method.text: Applies focus to the on-screen cell that corresponds to the intersection of the element in the CDF source document identified by strCdfId, and the cell at the given index.

method.name: focusRowById

param.name: strCdfId
param.text: jsxid property for CDF record

method.text: Applies focus to the on-screen row that corresponds to the element in the CDF source document identified by strCdfId. Note that since only cells can receive focus, this method will apply focus to the first cell child in the row.

method.name: getAutoRow
method.text: Returns whether or not an 'auto append' row will be rendered, allowing the user to automatically add new rows to the instance.

method.name: getAutoRowSession
method.text: Returns an object array of name/value pairs representing the current auto row session. When the session is committed, this object will be converted into a CDF Record for the instance.

method.name: getBodyBorder
method.text: Returns CSS property value(s) for a border (border: solid 1px #000000)

method.name: getCanReorder
method.text: Returns whether the column children can be reordered via user interaction. If no value is supplied the isntance will allow child columns to be reordered.

method.name: getCanSort
method.text: Returns whether the list will render with sortable columns. If null or jsx3.Boolean.TRUE, the instance is sortable.

method.name: getContentElement

param.name: strCdfId
param.text: jsxid property for CDF record

param.name: strAttName
param.text: attribute name on the CDF record. For example, jsxtext

method.text: Returns the HTML element that represents the intersection of the row identified by strCdfId and the first column mapped to the named CDF attribute, strAttName.

method.name: getFixedColumnIndex

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the zero-based index of the on-screen column(s), to the left of which will be fixed and cannot be reordered. For example, if this value is set to 1, the first column can never be reordered and will always remain the first column. If this value is set to 2, the first two columns will be fixed. Setting this value to 0 is effectively the same as setting it to null

method.name: getFocusStyle

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null (Matrix.FOCUS_STYLE)

method.text: Returns the CSS string to apply to a Row/Cell when it has focus

method.name: getHeaderBorder
method.text: Returns CSS property value(s) for a border (border: solid 1px #000000)

method.name: getHeaderHeight

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the height of the header row in pixels. If this value is not set (null), the list will render with the default value of jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_HEADER_HEIGHT.

method.name: getIcon

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

return.text: URL for icon to use. If null, jsx3.gui.Matrix.ICON will be applied when rendered.

method.text: Returns the icon to use for those CDF records that do not explicitly specify an icon via the jsximg attribute

method.name: getIconMinus

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

return.text: URL for icon. If null, jsx3.gui.Matrix.ICON_MINUS will be applied when rendered.

method.text: Returns the icon to use when the given tree node is in an open state.

method.name: getIconPlus

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

return.text: URL for icon to use. If null, jsx3.gui.Matrix.ICON_PLUS will be applied when rendered.

method.text: Returns the icon to use when the given tree node is in a closed state.

method.name: getPagingModel

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text:
Returns how data should be painted on-screen. If no value is specified, jsx3.gui.Matrix.PAGING_OFF will be applied. Note that the rendering model limits the available paging models:
Matrix.PAGING_OFF: Paint everthing to screen at once (container and data) (rendering model: all)
Matrix.PAGING_2PASS: Paint outer container and then perform a second pass to paint the data. (rendering model: deep, shallow)
Matrix.PAGING_CHUNKED: Paint outer container and then perform repeated paints until all data has been painted, regardless of scroll position. (rendering model: deep, shallow)
Matrix.PAGING_PAGED: Paint outer container. Paint First and last panels during second pass. Paint relevant panels when user scrolls to a given position. Discard excess panels. (rendering model: deep, shallow)
Matrix.PAGING_STEPPED: Paint root nodes and any open descendants. Paint others as they are toggled open. (rendering model: hierarchical)

method.name: getPanelPoolSize

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the number panels (a panel contains a collection of rows--getRowsPerPanel()) that should be part of the pool. If a panel count greater than this value exists, the panels furthest away (as calculated by the scroll position) from the active panel will be destroyed. If this value is null, the value defined by the constant, jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_PANEL_POOL_COUNT, will be used.

method.name: getPanelQueueSize

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Sets the number of panels that are allowed in the queue waiting to be painted. If null, the default value will be used: jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_PANEL_QUEUE_SIZE Note that this is different from the number of painted panels allowed on screen (e.g., getPanelPoolSize()).

method.name: getReaperInterval

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the the number of milliseconds to wait before checking for inactive panels to garbage collect. If null, the default value will be used: jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_REAPER_INTERVAL

method.name: getRenderNavigators

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns whether or not to render the navigation controls that are applied to the first column when rendering model is hierarchical. When not set the navigators are rendered.

method.name: getRenderingContext

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the jsxid of the CDF record that will serve as the origin when rendering the data on-screen. If not set, the id, jsxroot, (which is the id for the root node, <data>) will be used.

method.name: getRenderingModel

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the rendering model (how rows will be painted on-screen). If not set, the instance will render deep, meaning all descendants of the rendering context will be painted on-screen.

method.name: getResizable
method.text: Returns whether or not this column can be resized by the user. If not set, the column will be assumed resizable

method.name: getRowHeight

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the row height

method.name: getRowsPerPanel

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the number of rows each panel should contain. If null, the default value will be used: jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_ROWS_PER_PANEL

method.name: getScaleWidth
method.text: Returns whether or not the column widths should be adjusted (decremented) such that all columns fit within the viewport. If null or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE, scale width will not be used and the column widths will render fully, displaying a horizontal scrollbar when necessary. In such a case, all wildcard columns (e.g., *) will be resolved to the value, jsx3.gui.Matrix.Column.DEFAULT_WIDTH.

method.name: getScrollInfoLabel

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the info label to display when scrolling a paged instance, in order to show the scroll position.

method.name: getScrollLeft
method.text: Returns the horizontal scroll position of the list.

method.name: getScrollTop
method.text: Returns the vertical scroll position.

method.name: getSelectedIds
method.text: Returns the jsxid(s) for the selected record(s). Equivalent to this.getValue() except that the return value is always an Array.

method.name: getSelectedNodes
method.text: Returns the collection of selected records.

method.name: getSelectionBG

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null (Matrix.SELECTION_BG)

method.text: Returns the CSS string to apply to a Row/Cell when it has focus

method.name: getSelectionModel

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns the selection model. If no selection type is specified, the instance will employ single row selection (jsx3.gui.Matrix.SELECTION_ROW)

method.name: getSortDirection
method.text: Returns the direction (jsx3.gui.Matrix.SORT_ASCENDING or jsx3.gui.Matrix.SORT_DESCENDING) for the sorted column; if no direction specified, ascending is returned

method.name: getSortPath
method.text: Returns the name of the CDF attribute to sort on. If no value is set an empty string is returned by default.

method.name: getSortType
method.text: Returns the data type to be used for sorting this list. This value is either the one explicitly set with setSortType() or the data type of the current sort.

method.name: getSortedIds
method.text: Returns an array of all jsxid attributes in the source CDF in the order they would appear if painted on-screen

method.name: getSuppressHScroller

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns whether or not to supress display of the horizontal scrollbar. When not set, the scrollbar will display as needed.

method.name: getSuppressVScroller

param.name: strDefault
param.text: The default value to use if null

method.text: Returns whether or not to supress display of the vertical scrollbar. When not set, the scrollbar will display as needed.

method.name: getValue
method.text: Returns an array of selected values (or empty array) if the selection model is jsx3.gui.Matrix.SELECTION_MULTI_ROW. Returns a string (or null) for the other selection models

method.name: getXSL

return.text: jsx3.xml.Document instance containing valid XSL stylesheet

method.text: Returns XSLT, prioritizing the acquisition in the following order: 1) check cache; 2) check jsxxsl; 3) check jsxxslurl; 4) use default
method.deprecated: Per-instance control of the XSL template is deprecated

method.name: insertBefore

param.name: objMoveChild
param.text: the one being moved

param.name: objPrecedeChild
param.text: the one to insert before

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if false the repaint will be suppressed

method.text: Assigns objMoveChild as the previousSibling of objPrecedeChild

method.name: insertRecordProperty

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid attribute of the data record to modify.

param.name: strPropName
param.text: the name of the property to insert into the record.

param.name: strPropValue
param.text: the value of the property to insert.

param.name: bRedraw
param.text: if true or null, the on-screen view of this object is immediately updated to reflect the inserted property.

method.text: Inserts a new property into an existing record with jsxid equal to strRecordId. If the property already exists, the existing property value will be updated. If no such record exists in the XML document, this method fails quietly.

method.name: paint
method.text: Returns the DHTML, used for this object's on-screen VIEW

method.name: paintChild

param.name: objJSX
param.text: direct child whose generated VIEW will be directly inserted into the DOM to provide more efficient screen updates as repaint is costly for large applications

method.text: inserts DHTML (as string) into IE's on-screen DOM as a child of the object's on-screen VIEW

method.name: redrawCell

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: jsxid value for the record node (according to the CDF) corresponding to the on-screen row to update

param.name: objColumn
param.text: Column instance to update. Any sibling Columns that map to the same named attribute as objColumn (e.g., [objColumn].getPath()) as well as all sibling Columns that are triggered by the named attribute (e.g., [objColumn].getTriggers()) will also be redrawn.

param.name: bSuppressTriggers
param.text: if true, no other sibling Columns will be updated, even if they share a common path or designate the path as one of their triggers.

param.name: objTRXML
param.text: if present, use instead of generating the row XHTML via XSLT

method.text: Updates the on-screen cell to reflect the value in the CDF document to which the cell is mapped.

method.name: redrawMappedCells

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: The jsxid value for the record node (according to the CDF) corresponding to the on-screen row to update

param.name: strAttName
param.text: Named attribute on the CDF record. All Column children that map to this named attribute (e.g., [objColumn].getPath()) as well as all Column children that are triggered by the named attribute (e.g., [objColumn].getTriggers()) will be redrawn.

method.text: Updates the on-screen cell to reflect the value in the CDF document to which the cell is mapped.

method.name: redrawRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: jsxid value for the record node (according to the CDF) to redraw

param.name: intAction
param.text: jsx3.xml.CDF.INSERT, jsx3.xml.CDF.INSERTBEFORE, jsx3.xml.CDF.DELETE, or jsx3.xml.CDF.UPDATE.

param.name: bRecurse
param.text: if != false, any necessary recursion for flattened inserts will be automatically handled

method.text: Matrix implementation.

method.name: repaint

return.text: the result of calling paint() or null if this object is not displayed.

method.text: Updates the view of this object by calling paint() and replacing the current view with the returned HTML. This method has no effect if this object is not currently displayed.

method.name: repaintData
method.text: Paints only the data rows. Call for quick repainting of the data rows when only the source data has changed. Does not recalculate and reprofile the box profile and resulting XSLT. Retains scroll position when possible.

method.name: repaintHead
method.text: Repaints the header row for improved runtime efficiency. For example, a minor text change to a label in a header row shouldn't repaint the entirety of the instance

method.name: resetCacheData

param.name: objServer
param.text: the server owning the cache to modify. This is a required argument only if this.getServer() does not returns a server instance.

method.text: Removes the XML source document stored under the XML ID of this object from the server cache.

method.name: resetFocusContext
method.text: Removes the focus style from whichever cell is designated to have focus context. Once focus context is applied to the active cell in a matrix, the focus style will continue to be applied to the active cell until another cell is set as the active cell or the Matrix is repainted via a call to repaint or repaintData.

method.name: resetMask
method.text: Ends any existing edit session and hides the active mask. This is a carryover method from grid.

method.name: resetXmlCacheData

param.name: objServer
param.text: the server owning the cache to modify. This is a required argument only if this.getServer() does not returns a server instance.

method.text: Removes the XML source document stored under the XML ID of this object from the server cache.

method.name: revealRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the id of the record to reveal

method.text: Reveals a record by toggling parent nodes open (if rendering hierarcally) and scrolling the record into view.

method.name: selectRecord

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the jsxid of the record to select.

method.text: Selects a CDF record of this list. The item will be highlighted in the view and the CDF data will be updated accordingly. If this list is a multi-select list then this selection will be added to any previous selection.

method.name: setAutoRow

param.name: intBoolean
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE if the column widths should be adjusted to fully fit within the viewport

method.text: Sets whether or not an 'auto append' row will be rendered, allowing the user to automatically add new rows to the instance. Note that if the rendering model is hierarchical or the paging model is jsx3.gui.Matrix.PAGING_PAGED, the auto row feature is disabled. The CSS style for the auto row (a TR element) can be modified via the XSL Parameters palette, via the XSL parameter, jsx_autorow_style

method.name: setBodyBorder

param.name: strCSS
param.text: valid CSS property value for a border (border: solid 1px #000000)

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring. Typically property updates that affect the browser-specific box model (such as borders) are repainted immediately to keep the box model abstraction in synch with the native view. However, the repaint can be suppressed to avoid unnecessary reparsing of the XSLT during repeated property updates.

method.text: Sets CSS property value(s) for a border (border: solid 1px #000000). Updates MODEL and VIEW (unless repaint is suppressed).

method.name: setCanReorder

param.name: REORDER
param.text: one of: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether the columns in the list can be re-ordered via user interaction with the VIEW

method.name: setCanSort

param.name: SORT
param.text: one of jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether the list will render with sortable columns.

method.name: setFixedColumnIndex

param.name: intIndex
param.text: positive integer

method.text: Sets the zero-based index of the on-screen column(s), to the left of which will be fixed and cannot be reordered.

method.name: setFocusStyle

param.name: strCSS
param.text: Valid CSS. For example: font-weight:bold;color:orange;

method.text: Sets the CSS string to apply to a Row/Cell when it has focus. NOTE: Passing styles that affect position, left, top, width, height, border, background-image, padding, and margin (those reserved by the class) can have undesired effects.

method.name: setHeaderBorder

param.name: strCSS
param.text: valid CSS property value for a border (border: solid 1px #000000)

method.text: Sets CSS property value(s) for a border on the header row (border: solid 1px #000000). Updates both model and view.

method.name: setHeaderHeight

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring. Typically property updates that affect the browser-specific box model (such as height) are repainted immediately to keep the box model abstraction in sync with the native view. However, the repaint can be suppressed to avoid unnecessary reparsing of the XSLT during repeated property updates.

method.text: Sets the height of the header row in pixels. Set to zero (0) to hide the header row and only render the body rows.

method.name: setIcon

param.name: strURL
param.text: URL for icon to use

method.text: Sets the icon to use for those CDF records that do not explicitly specify an icon via the jsximg attribute

method.name: setIconMinus

param.name: strURL
param.text: URL (preferably relative)

method.text: Sets the icon to use when the given tree node is in an open state.

method.name: setIconPlus

param.name: strURL
param.text: URL (preferably relative)

method.text: Sets the icon to use when the given tree node is in a closed state.

method.name: setPagingModel

param.name: intModel
param.text: one of: Matrix. PAGING_OFF, PAGING_2PASS, PAGING_CHUNKED, PAGING_PAGED, PAGING_STEPPED

method.text: Sets how data should be painted on-screen. If no value is specified, jsx3.gui.Matrix.PAGING_OFF will be applied.

method.name: setPanelPoolSize
method.text: Sets the number panels (a panel contains a collection of rows--getRowsPerPanel()) that should be part of the pool.

method.name: setPanelQueueSize
method.text: Sets the number of panels that are allowed in the queue waiting to be painted. Can be tuned up or down to optimize performance given the amount of data, connection speed, etc

method.name: setReaperInterval

param.name: intInterval
param.text: number of milliseconds

method.text: Sets the the number of milliseconds to wait before checking for inactive panels to garbage collect.

method.name: setRenderNavigators

param.name: intTrueFalse
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring. Typically property updates that affect the browser-specific box model (such as rendering the navigational controls) are repainted immediately to keep the box model abstraction in synch with the native view. However, the repaint can be suppressed to avoid unnecessary reparsing of the XSLT during repeated property updates.

method.text: Sets whether or not to render the navigation controls on the first column when being rendered in hierarchical mode.

method.name: setRenderingContext

param.name: strJsxId
param.text: jsxid property for the CDF record to use as the contextual root when rendering data on-screen.

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring.

method.text: Sets the jsxid of the CDF record that will serve as the origin when rendering the data on-screen.

method.name: setRenderingModel

param.name: MODEL
param.text: one of: shallow, deep, or hierarchical

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring.

method.text: Sets the rendering model (how rows will be painted on-screen).

method.name: setResizable
method.text: Sets whether or not this column can be resized by the user. If not set, the column will be assumed resizable. Note that if the parent Matrix is set as NOT resizable, this setting is ignored and no child columns can be resized

method.name: setRowHeight

param.name: intHeight
param.text: height in pixels

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring. Typically property updates that affect the browser-specific box model (such as padding) are repainted immediately to keep the box model abstraction in synch with the native view. However, the repaint can be suppressed to avoid unnecessary reparsing of the XSLT during repeated property updates.

method.text: Sets the on-screen row height. If row height is null, the default row height will be used (jsx3.gui.Matrix.DEFAULT_ROW_HEIGHT). If row height is 0, the row height is flexible and the row's height will expand to fit the content.

method.name: setRowsPerPanel

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring.

method.text: Sets the number of rows each panel should contain.

method.name: setScaleWidth

param.name: intBoolean
param.text: One of: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether or not the column widths should be adjusted such that all columns visually display within the viewport. Defaults to jsx3.Boolean.FALSE if not set, meaning a horizontal scrollbar will appear if the aggregate column widths exceed the available width of the viewport.

method.name: setScrollInfoLabel

param.name: strLabel
param.text:
valid HTML/Text. Set to an empty string to suppress any label from displaying.
Wildcards are as follows:
  • {0} The index position of the first visible on-screen row
  • {1} The index position of the last visible on-screen row
  • {2} Total count of all records in the list

method.text: Sets the standard info label to display when scrolling to show the scroll position. If no label is supplied an appropriate localized value will be used. Set to an empty string to suppress any label from displaying.

method.name: setScrollLeft

param.name: intScrollLeft
param.text: a non-negative number

method.text: Sets the horizontal scroll position.

method.name: setScrollTop

param.name: intScrollTop
param.text: a non-negative number

method.text: Sets the vertical scroll position.

method.name: setSelectionBG
method.text: Sets the URL for the image to use (as the repeating background image) to denote selection.

method.name: setSelectionModel

param.name: intType
param.text: one of: jsx3.gui.Matrix.SELECTION_UNSELECTABLE, jsx3.gui.Matrix.SELECTION_ROW, jsx3.gui.Matrix.SELECTION_MULTI_ROW

method.text: Sets the selection model

method.name: setSortDirection

param.name: intSortDir
param.text: one of: jsx3.gui.Matrix.SORT_ASCENDING or jsx3.gui.Matrix.SORT_DESCENDING

method.text: Sets the direction (ascending or descending) for the sorted column.

method.name: setSortPath
method.text: Sets the name of the CDF attribute to sort on. The records in the data source of this matrix are sorted on this attribute before being painted to screen.

method.name: setSortType

param.name: DATATYPE
param.text: data type for this column's data; ; valid types include: jsx3.gui.Matrix.Column.TYPE_TEXT and jsx3.gui.Matrix.Column.TYPE_NUMBER

method.text: Sets the data type for the list. This explicit value will override any column data type if set. If it is not set the data type specific to the sort column is used for sorting.

method.name: setSuppressHScroller

param.name: intTrueFalse
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

method.text: Sets whether or not to supress display of the horizontal scrollbar. Updates both model and view

method.name: setSuppressVScroller

param.name: intTrueFalse
param.text: jsx3.Boolean.TRUE or jsx3.Boolean.FALSE

param.name: bSuppressRepaint
param.text: Pass true to stop the default repaint from occurring. Typically property updates that affect the browser-specific box model (such as rendering the vertical scrollbar) are repainted immediately to keep the box model abstraction in synch with the native view. However, the repaint can be suppressed to avoid unnecessary reparsing of the XSLT during repeated property updates.

method.text: Sets whether or not to supress display of the vertical scrollbar. Updates both model and view.

method.name: setValue

param.name: strId
param.text: jsxid attribute for the CDF record(s) to select

method.text: Sets the value of this matrix. Deselects all existing selections. Scrolls the first record into view.

method.name: setXMLId
method.text: Sets the XML ID of this object. This value is the key under which the XML source document of this object is saved in the cache of the server owning this object. The developer may specify either a unique or shared value. If no value is specified, a unique id is generated.

method.name: setXMLString

param.name: strXML
param.text: null or a well-formed serialized XML element.

method.text: Sets the XML string of this object. Setting this value to the string serialization of an XML document is one way of specifying the source XML document of this object.

method.name: setXMLURL

param.name: strXMLURL
param.text: null or a URI that when resolved against the server owning this object specifies a valid XML document.

method.text: Sets the XML URL of this object. Settings this value to the URI of an XML document is one way of specifying the source XML document of this object.

method.name: synchronizeVScroller
method.text: Updates the scroll height and scroll position of the vertical scrollbar. When a Matrix instance has a display property of none (or is contained by an ancestor with a display of none) and the Matrix is repainted (repaint/repaintData), the browser will misreport how large the content actually is. When the Matrix is then restored the scrollbars will be disabled. By calling this method after the view has been restored (i.e., when display is set to block), the scrollbars will reflect the accurate height.

method.name: toggleItem

param.name: strRecordId
param.text: the 'jsxid' attribute on the given CDF record to toggle

param.name: bOpen
param.text: if null, the open state will be toggled

method.text: Toggles the open/closed state for a node in the Matrix
